topk.name: RapidAPI

required.name: domainname
required.description: The name of the domain looked up.

required.name: thinwhois
required.description: 1 results in returning whois data from the registry only, without fetching data from the registrar. Returned registry data are to be found in the WhoisRecord → registryData schema element. Accepted values are 0 and 1, the default is 0.

required.name: callback
required.description: A JAVAscript function used when outputFormat is JSON; this is an implementation known as JSONP which invokes the callback on the returned response.

required.name: preferfresh
required.description: Can be 0 or 1. 1 results in getting the latest Whois record even if it is incomplete. Defaults to 0.

required.name: checkproxydata
required.description: 1 results in fetching proxy/whois guard data, if found, they are returned in the WhoisRecord → privateWhoisProxy schema element. Accepted values are 0 and 1, the default is 0.

required.name: _parse
required.description: This parameter enables the use of the API for parsing WHOIS raw text provided in the query.1 provides parsing for input WHOIS raw texts described at the parameters registryRawText and registrarRawText. Accepted values are 0 and 1, the default is 0.

required.name: registryrawtext
required.description: The string containing the registry WHOIS raw text to be parsed; works only when the _parse parameter is equal to 1.

required.name: registrarrawtext
required.description: A string containing the registrar WHOIS raw text to be parsed; works only when the _parse parameter is equal to 1.

required.name: ipwhois
required.description: 1 results in returning the WHOIS record for the hosting IP if the WHOIS record for the domain is not supported. For unsupported TLDs, domain NameServers are returned if the ipWhois flag is activated, a WHOIS record for the hosting IP is added to the result.  Accepted values are 0 and 1, the default is 0.

required.name: ip
required.description: Return IPs for the domain name. Accepted values are 0 and 1. Defaults to 0: no IPs are returned. 1 results in returning IPs.

required.name: da
required.description: Perform domain availability check. Accepted values are 0, 1 and 2. Defaults to 0: no domain availability check is performed. When set to 1 the result contains a quick check on domain availability, 2 is slower but more accurate. Results are returned under WhoisRecord → domainAvailability (AVAILABLE | UNAVAILABLE | UNDETERMINED).

required.name: outputformat
required.description: Response output format.  Acceptable values: XML or JSON. Defaults to XML.

topk.description: WHOIS API (v2) returns well-parsed WHOIS records with fields in XML and JSON formats for any IPv4, IPv6 address, domain name, or email.

- Default is 50
- Maximum is 150", "type": "NUMBER"}, {"name": "max_cursor", "description": "Pagination cursor", "type": "NUMBER"}], "optional": []}

- Default is 50

required.description:
The message you will leave while sending request.  You can customize the message by using variables. For example, \"Hello [target_name],  would love to connect with you.\" is the message you want to send, here target_name is a variable, written in squared brackets '[]'. Assuming the target's name is John Wick then the resulting string will be, \"Hello John Wick, would love to connect with you.\"
Note: Please take care of the spelling while adding the variable(s).

topk.text:
RapidAPI::requests.get
Fast and Simple API to search for products, offers and reviews on Amazon in real-time.
params: {"required": [{"name": "asin", "description": "Product ASIN for which to get details. Supports batching of up to 10 ASINs in a single request, separated by comma (e.g. *B08PPDJWC8,B07ZPKBL9V, B08BHXG144*).

Note that each ASIN in a batch request is counted as a single request against the plan quota.", "type": "STRING"}, {"name": "country", "description": "Sets the marketplace country, language and currency. 

**Default:** `US`

**Allowed values:**  `US, AU, BR, CA, CN, FR, DE, IN, IT, MX, NL, SG, ES, TR, AE, GB, JP`", "type": "STRING"}], "optional": []}
topk.name: RapidAPI

required.name: asin
required.description:
Product ASIN for which to get details. Supports batching of up to 10 ASINs in a single request, separated by comma (e.g. *B08PPDJWC8,B07ZPKBL9V, B08BHXG144*).

Note that each ASIN in a batch request is counted as a single request against the plan quota.

required.name: country
required.description:
Sets the marketplace country, language and currency. 

**Default:** `US`

**Allowed values:**  `US, AU, BR, CA, CN, FR, DE, IN, IT, MX, NL, SG, ES, TR, AE, GB, JP`

topk.description: Fast and Simple API to search for products, offers and reviews on Amazon in real-time.

With our API, you can ensure your messages are delivered effectively, and that your sender reputation stays in good standing. Whether you're a small business or a large enterprise, our API is designed to simplify your email management and help you achieve better email performance. Contact us today to ...

topk.name: RapidAPI

required.name: email
required.description: Email Address

topk.description: Analyse the content of an Email Address and check if it is valid or not. Email API can recode the Email Address if any common error or misspelling is found. The API can also check for invalid or fake DNS. [This API is under maintenance and is not working properly]

topk.name: RapidAPI
topk.description: Email Validation Service. check if a specific e-mail address is valid. Is it a proper domain? Is the e-mail a temporary/disposable e-mail? Our API contains 180k disposable email domains and gives the most valid email

topk.name: RapidAPI
topk.description: “Validate Email” before you send. Discover deliverability of email addresses by our most popular email verification API.

topk.name: RapidAPI

required.name: domain
required.description: Full e-mail, or domain to check if valid or temporary/disposable. You can enter an e-mail address, and it will be converted to a domain, but entering just the domain is recommended for user privacy reasons.

topk.description: Easily check if a certain e-mail address is valid. Is it a valid domain? Is the e-mail a temporary/disposable e-mail? That's a common indicator of spamming/trolling, so now there's an API for you so you can easily block it!

topk.name: RapidAPI
topk.description: APISOLUTION services provide a comprehensive API for fast email validation and verification for any developer to use on start-ups and staff projects.

topk.name: RapidAPI
topk.description: This Email API is helpful to validate email addresses(single or bulk, using txt and csv), detect temporary, get fake emails, check free emails, check MX records and identify free/paid email service providers.

topk.name: RapidAPI
topk.description: A simple API to verify email addresses in making sure they are valid and real, for ensuring you are sending emails to actual people!

topk.name: RapidAPI

required.name: email

topk.description: Email address validation API

topk.name: RapidAPI
topk.description: Stop guessing if an email is valid or full. With this API, you can determine first hand if the email is deliverable and working. Not only can this API detect if an email is formatted correctly, it also uses various methods to verify if the email is actually valid

topk.name: RapidAPI
topk.description: This is an easy way to check if a email address is disposable or valid so you can avoid fake users on your database.

topk.text:
RapidAPI::requests.get
Fast and Simple API to search for products, offers and reviews on Amazon in real-time.
params: {"required": [{"name": "asin", "description": "Product ASIN for which to get details. Supports batching of up to 10 ASINs in a single request, separated by comma (e.g. *B08PPDJWC8,B07ZPKBL9V, B08BHXG144*).

Note that each ASIN in a batch request is counted as a single request against the plan quota.", "type": "STRING"}, {"name": "country", "description": "Sets the marketplace country, language and currency. 

**Default:** `US`

**Allowed values:**  `US, AU, BR, CA, CN, FR, DE, IN, IT, MX, NL, SG, ES, TR, AE, GB, JP`", "type": "STRING"}], "optional": []}
topk.name: RapidAPI

required.name: asin
required.description:
Product ASIN for which to get details. Supports batching of up to 10 ASINs in a single request, separated by comma (e.g. *B08PPDJWC8,B07ZPKBL9V, B08BHXG144*).

Note that each ASIN in a batch request is counted as a single request against the plan quota.

required.name: country
required.description:
Sets the marketplace country, language and currency. 

**Default:** `US`

**Allowed values:**  `US, AU, BR, CA, CN, FR, DE, IN, IT, MX, NL, SG, ES, TR, AE, GB, JP`

topk.description: Fast and Simple API to search for products, offers and reviews on Amazon in real-time.

topk.text:
RapidAPI::requests.get
market data for used apple products
params: {"required": [{"name": "manufacturernumbase64encoded", "description": "A manufacturer number of an apple product, base64 encoded, e.g for a Apple MacBook Pro 13\\\" 2020 with manufacturer number MWP72D/A -> TVdQNzJEL0E=", "type": "string"}, {"name": "condition", "description": "ENUM, valid values are: USED, NEW, DEFECT, REFURBISHED

Note: Until now in v1, only values USED and REFURBISHED are allowed and give the same results (no distringuish between USED or REFURBISHED, so use any of the two.
In a future release, the other values will be also supported.", "type": "ENUM"}], "optional": []}
topk.name: RapidAPI

required.name: manufacturernumbase64encoded
required.description: A manufacturer number of an apple product, base64 encoded, e.g for a Apple MacBook Pro 13\\\" 2020 with manufacturer number MWP72D/A -> TVdQNzJEL0E=

required.name: condition
required.description:
ENUM, valid values are: USED, NEW, DEFECT, REFURBISHED

Note: Until now in v1, only values USED and REFURBISHED are allowed and give the same results (no distringuish between USED or REFURBISHED, so use any of the two.
In a future release, the other values will be also supported.

topk.description: market data for used apple products

topk.text:
RapidAPI::requests.get
Extremely comprehensive and up-to-date local business search - get business reviews and rating, photos, phone, address / location, website, emails / social profiles and 30+ other fields.
params: {"required": [{"name": "business_id", "description": "Unique Business Id of the business for which to get reviews.", "type": "STRING"}, {"name": "sort_by", "description": "How to sort the reviews in the results.

**Allowed values**: *`most_relevant, newest, highest_ranking, lowest_ranking`*.

**Default**: *`most_relevant`*", "type": "ENUM"}, {"name": "region", "description": "Query Google Maps from a particular region or country. For a list of supported region/country codes see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes (Alpha-2 code).

**Default:** *`us`*", "type": "STRING"}, {"name": "language", "description": "Set the language of the results. For a list of supported language codes see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes .

**Default**: *`en`*", "type": "STRING"}, {"name": "offset", "description": "Number of business reviews to skip (for pagination/scrolling).

**Default**: *`0`*", "type": "NUMBER"}, {"name": "fields", "description": "A comma separated list of review fields to include in the response (field projection). By default all fields are returned.

**e.g.** `review_id,review_text,rating`", "type": "STRING"}, {"name": "query", "description": "Return reviews matching a text query.", "type": "STRING"}, {"name": "limit", "description": "Maximum number of business reviews to return (1-150).

**Default**: *`20`*", "type": "NUMBER"}], "optional": []}
topk.name: RapidAPI

required.name: business_id
required.description: Unique Business Id of the business for which to get reviews.

required.name: sort_by
required.description:
How to sort the reviews in the results.

**Allowed values**: *`most_relevant, newest, highest_ranking, lowest_ranking`*.

**Default**: *`most_relevant`*

required.name: region
required.description:
Query Google Maps from a particular region or country. For a list of supported region/country codes see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes (Alpha-2 code).

**Default:** *`us`*

required.name: language
required.description:
Set the language of the results. For a list of supported language codes see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes .

**Default**: *`en`*

required.name: offset
required.description:
Number of business reviews to skip (for pagination/scrolling).

**Default**: *`0`*

required.name: fields
required.description:
A comma separated list of review fields to include in the response (field projection). By default all fields are returned.

**e.g.** `review_id,review_text,rating`

required.name: query
required.description: Return reviews matching a text query.

required.name: limit
required.description:
Maximum number of business reviews to return (1-150).

**Default**: *`20`*

topk.description: Extremely comprehensive and up-to-date local business search - get business reviews and rating, photos, phone, address / location, website, emails / social profiles and 30+ other fields.

topk.text:
RapidAPI::requests.get
Our free API provides real-time and historical crypto trading data from 4 major exchanges, enriched with over 30 customizable trading indicators. It offers up to 5000 rows of data in a single request, ensuring comprehensive market analysis. The API is user-friendly and offers improved data fetching capabilities compared to standard exchange documentation, making it an essential tool for traders and developers alike.
params: {"required": [{"name": "symbol", "description": "", "type": "STRING"}, {"name": "exchange", "description": "", "type": "STRING"}, {"name": "market", "description": "Available markets are:

spot
usdt-perpetual
inverse-perpetual", "type": "STRING"}, {"name": "interval", "description": "", "type": "STRING"}, {"name": "from", "description": "", "type": "STRING"}, {"name": "backtracks", "description": "", "type": "NUMBER"}], "optional": []}
topk.name: RapidAPI

required.name: market
required.description:
Available markets are:

spot
usdt-perpetual
inverse-perpetual

The API is user-friendly and offers improved data fetching capabilities compared to standard exchange documentation, making it an essential tool for traders and developers alike.
